This document goes on at great length to describe
a formidable activity spectrum in reseach-testing
procedures, and hypothesized results, at a cost
of roughly eighty nine (89) thousand dollars for
one year.
What we found absent from the descriptions about
"how learning occurs" was recognition of the
possibility that children might also learn from
one another. What we did find was that, as a
possible result of this research effort, feelings
of inadequacy could be reinforced, with equal
